With 73m² of thoughtfully designed living space on a private plot, this bungalow provides the ideal base for enjoying the Mediterranean lifestyle you've earned. The property's strong investment fundamentals—with the market appreciating at 8% year-on-year—mean your home is also a sound financial decision. Whether you're downsizing, seeking affordable European living, or looking for a secure investment with rental income potential, this Ciudad Quesada bungalow delivers on all fronts.
areaSection: Ciudad Quesada sits in the heart of the Costa Blanca, approximately 30 kilometers inland from the Mediterranean coast yet close enough for regular beach visits. This strategic location combines the tranquility of inland living with easy access to coastal attractions. The area enjoys 320+ days of annual sunshine, with mild winters and warm summers—ideal for those escaping harsher climates. Originally developed as a planned community, Ciudad Quesada has evolved into a mature, well-established neighborhood with excellent infrastructure. The town benefits from modern amenities, reliable services, and a cosmopolitan atmosphere. Surrounded by the natural beauty of the Region of Murcia and Valencian countryside, residents enjoy a peaceful setting without the intensity of beachfront tourist areas. The elevation provides cooler temperatures during summer months, while the climate remains consistently pleasant year-round, making outdoor activities enjoyable throughout the year.
lifestyleSection: Life in Ciudad Quesada revolves around a relaxed, community-focused rhythm that appeals strongly to retirees. The established expat community ensures you'll find English speakers, familiar services, and a welcoming social scene. Weekly markets offer fresh local produce, while international supermarkets cater to diverse tastes. Numerous restaurants and cafés—many operated by long-term residents—create a genuine neighborhood feel. Healthcare is outstanding, with English-speaking doctors and modern facilities within minutes. The cost of living remains reasonable, stretching your retirement funds further than in Northern Europe or North America. Morning walks, afternoon coffee with friends, and evening meals al fresco are the rhythm of daily life here. Golf courses, hiking trails, and water activities are easily accessible. Beach days require just a 20-minute drive, allowing you to enjoy Mediterranean waters without the crowded tourist infrastructure. This is living at a genuinely human pace.
investmentSection: Beyond lifestyle, this property represents solid financial sense. Ciudad Quesada property prices have appreciated 8% year-on-year, outpacing inflation and delivering real wealth protection. At €4,110/m², this bungalow commands premium specification pricing—justified by its quality finishes and location—yet remains 40% cheaper than equivalent properties on Spanish islands. The rental market is active; comparable properties generate approximately €800 per week during peak seasons, providing optional income if you choose. Many retirees offset their ownership costs by renting for 4-6 months annually, essentially subsidizing their retirement residence. The Costa Blanca remains Europe's most accessible Mediterranean market for foreign buyers, with established legal frameworks and transparent transactions. Your investment benefits from currency diversification, potential appreciation, and the flexibility to generate income when desired.
conclusion: This 2-bedroom bungalow represents genuine opportunity—a quality property in an established, welcoming community at exceptional value. Ciudad Quesada offers the complete retirement package: year-round sunshine, affordable living, outstanding healthcare, genuine community, and strong investment fundamentals. At €300,000 with premium specifications and 8% annual appreciation, you're making both a lifestyle choice and a sound financial decision. lifeAndAmenities.intro: Ciudad Quesada provides everything needed for comfortable, independent living. Modern infrastructure, reliable services, and an international community mean daily life is convenient and stress-free. Healthcare, shopping, transport, and education are all accessible and of good quality.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in the Costa Blanca is among Spain's best. Multiple English-speaking doctors practice in Ciudad Quesada and surrounding towns, many trained in UK or North American systems and familiar with expat healthcare needs. The regional hospital in Alicante (30 minutes) is well-equipped with modern facilities. Private clinics offer faster appointment times and English-speaking staff. Prescription medications are affordable and readily available. Most retirees maintain private health insurance (typically €50-100 monthly), ensuring rapid access to specialists without NHS waiting times. Dental care is excellent and remarkably affordable. Medical tourism isn't necessary—local healthcare quality matches Western standards at fraction of the cost.
keyPoints: English-speaking doctors available within Ciudad Quesada
Hospital General de Alicante - 30 minutes by car
Private clinics with rapid appointment access
Affordable prescription medications and dental care

education.text: While most retirees don't require schools, Ciudad Quesada has excellent options for visiting grandchildren or younger family members. British-curriculum international schools operate throughout the region, offering familiar education systems. Spanish state schools are free and of good quality. Several private international schools teach in English, French, or bilingual curricula. Universities are accessible in nearby Alicante and Murcia for those pursuing further education. Educational quality remains high, with many schools boasting excellent exam results and well-trained staff.
keyPoints: Multiple English-language private schools in region

shopping.text: Shopping is convenient and varied. Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum supermarkets operate throughout Ciudad Quesada, stocking both Spanish and international products. Weekly markets offer fresh produce at excellent prices—a social event as much as shopping opportunity. Shopping centers with clothing, electronics, and services are nearby. Specialty shops cater to specific needs. Online shopping is reliable for anything not readily available locally. The expat community means most international brands and foods are obtainable. Prices for quality goods remain significantly lower than Northern Europe.
keyPoints: Weekly local markets with fresh produce
Shopping centers with diverse retail within 10 minutes

transport.text: Alicante-Elche Airport (45 minutes) connects to most European destinations with multiple daily flights. Bus services link Ciudad Quesada to surrounding towns, though a car is recommended for maximum flexibility. The area is very driving-friendly with good roads and minimal traffic outside summer months. Parking is abundant and usually free. Many retirees maintain vehicle use for coastal trips and exploring the region. Fuel is affordable compared to Northern Europe. Public transport options ensure you can manage without driving if preferred, though most residents appreciate automotive independence.

faqs.question: Является ли Коста-Бланка хорошим местом для покупки недвижимости?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Costa Blanca offers reliable appreciation (8% year-on-year), affordable living costs, excellent healthcare, and a welcoming expat community. Property values remain stable, protected by transparent Spanish legal frameworks. Unlike purely tourist-focused areas, Ciudad Quesada provides genuine community infrastructure. The region has attracted international residents for over 50 years, establishing proven track records and mature services.

faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners have exactly the same property purchase rights as Spanish citizens. No special permits or restrictions apply. You'll need a Spanish Tax ID number (simple to obtain) and must use a notary to complete the transaction—standard practice that protects your interests. Many established expat communities in Ciudad Quesada can recommend experienced English-speaking legal advisors familiar with international buyer needs.

faqs.question: Каковы расходы на покупку недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 8-12% in additional costs: 6-7% transfer tax, 1-2% notary fees, and property registration costs. Some sellers' closing costs apply. Renovations or improvements vary by scope. Annual ownership costs include property tax (0.4-1.1% of registered value annually), utilities, and optional maintenance. These costs remain very reasonable compared to Northern Europe, contributing to Spain's attractiveness for retirees.

faqs.question: What is the cost of living in Ciudad Quesada?
faqs.answer: Very reasonable. Monthly expenses for retirees typically range €1,200-1,800, including rent, utilities, food, healthcare, and entertainment. Groceries cost 30-40% less than UK/Northern Europe. Restaurants range €10-20 per person for quality meals. Healthcare is affordable; private insurance costs €50-100 monthly. Your retirement income stretches dramatically further here, allowing a comfortable lifestyle at fraction of Northern European costs.

faqs.question: Подходит ли Коста-Бланка для пенсионеров?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca has become a retirement destination specifically because it offers year-round sunshine, affordable living, outstanding healthcare, established English-speaking communities, and Mediterranean lifestyle. The infrastructure—from healthcare to markets to recreational activities—is mature and reliable. Many residents live here 20+ years, developing deep community connections and enjoying genuinely happy retirements. The relaxed pace and friendly environment are particularly valued by those leaving stressful careers.

faqs.question: Как далеко Коста-Бланка от России?
faqs.answer: Approximately 1,400 kilometers (870 miles). Direct flights from Alicante Airport to UK destinations take 2.5-3 hours. Multiple daily flights make visiting family easy and affordable. Many retirees visit UK quarterly while maintaining permanent residence in Spain. The combination of direct flights and reasonable flight costs means staying connected with UK family while enjoying Spanish retirement—having both worlds.

faqs.question: Какая погода на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Exceptional for retirees. Average 320 days of annual sunshine, with winter temperatures 15-18°C and summers 28-32°C. Rainfall is minimal (5-6 rainy days monthly). The Mediterranean climate is gentle—not extreme. Inland Ciudad Quesada stays cooler than coastal areas during summer heat. This reliably pleasant weather supports year-round outdoor activities without the harsh winters many retirees escape or brutal summers that exhaust elderly residents. Most people report their arthritis and respiratory conditions improve significantly.

faqs.question: Могу ли я получить ипотеку в Испании как иностранец?
faqs.answer: Yes, several Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically up to 80% of property value. Terms are generally favorable (3-4% interest rates). You'll need proof of income, savings, and a Spanish Tax ID. Many expat financial advisors specialize in helping foreign buyers navigate mortgage options. Some prefer to purchase outright given excellent value and cost-of-living advantages. Professional advice helps optimize your financial strategy.

faqs.question: Why is this property priced at €4,110/m² when the area average is €2,200/m²?
faqs.answer: This represents premium specification pricing reflecting the bungalow's quality finishes, thoughtful design, and location within Ciudad Quesada's most developed areas. Comparable properties in equivalent condition command similar prices. What makes this exceptional value is the 40% discount versus Spanish islands—equivalent properties in Ibiza, Mallorca, or Canaries cost €6,500-7,500/m². You're paying for quality at dramatically below-market rates, with 8% annual appreciation providing strong investment fundamentals.
